Table of Contents

Class MPVRenderContext

Namespace
Nickvision.MPVSharp.Internal

MPV Render Context. This object can be used to make mpv render using supported graphic APIs (such as OpenGL).

public class MPVRenderContext

Constructors

MPVRenderContext()

Construct MPVRenderContext

public MPVRenderContext()

Methods

Create(nint, MPVRenderParam[])

Initialize the renderer state. Depending on the backend used, this will access the underlying GPU API and initialize its own objects.

public MPVError Create(nint clientHandle, MPVRenderParam[] param)

Parameters

clientHandle nint

Pointer to MPVClient

param MPVRenderParam[]

An array of parameters, terminated by { MPVRenderParamType.Invalid, 0 }

Returns

MPVError

Error code

Free()

Destroy the mpv renderer state.

public void Free()

GetInfo(MPVRenderParam)

Retrieve information from the render context.

public MPVError GetInfo(MPVRenderParam param)

Parameters

param MPVRenderParam

The parameter type and data that should be retrieved

Returns

MPVError

Error code

Render(MPVRenderParam[])

Render video.

public MPVError Render(MPVRenderParam[] param)

Parameters

param MPVRenderParam[]

An array of parameters, terminated by { MPVRenderParamType.Invalid, 0 }

Returns

MPVError

Error code

Remarks

You should pass the following parameters:

  • Backend-specific target object, such as MPVRenderParam.OpenGLFBO.
  • Possibly transformations, such as MPVRenderParam.FlipY.

ReportSwap()

Tell the renderer that a frame was flipped at the given time. This is optional, but can help the player to achieve better timing.

public void ReportSwap()

Remarks

Calling this at least once informs libmpv that you will use this function. If you use it inconsistently, expect bad video playback.

SetParameter(MPVRenderParam)

Attempt to change a single parameter. Not all backends and parameter types support all kinds of changes.

public MPVError SetParameter(MPVRenderParam param)

Parameters

param MPVRenderParam

The parameter type and data that should be set

Returns

MPVError

Error code

SetUpdateCallback(MPVRenderUpdateFn, nint)

Set the callback that notifies you when a new video frame is available, or if the video display configuration somehow changed and requires a redraw.

public void SetUpdateCallback(MPVRenderContext.MPVRenderUpdateFn callback, nint data = 0)

Parameters

callback MPVRenderContext.MPVRenderUpdateFn

Callback that will be called if the frame should be redrawn

data nint

Arbitrary data pointer to pass to the callback

Remarks

You must not call any mpv API from the callback or exit from callback in unusual way (such as by throwing an exception)

Update()

The API user is supposed to call this when the update callback was invoked

public ulong Update()

Returns

ulong

A bitset of MPVRenderUpdateFlag values indicating what should happen next

Remarks

This has to happen on the render thread, and not from the update callback itself. This is optional if MPVRenderParam with type AdvancedControl wasn't set.
